remarks: A singleton family is an internal direct product, the product of which is the given subgroup.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dmdprdpr.z $e |- Z = ( Cntz ` G ) $.
dmdprdpr.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
dmdprdpr.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
dmdprdpr.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
dprdpr.s $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` G ) $.
dprdpr.1 $e |- ( ph -> S C_ ( Z ` T ) ) $.
dprdpr.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( S i^i T ) = { .0. } ) $.
dprdpr $p |- ( ph -> ( G DProd `' ( { S } +c { T } ) ) = ( S .(+) T ) ) $.
